page.title: 18Public Transport
page.content: All buses in{TAMESIDE}are provided by {GREATER MANCHESTER TRANSPORT.}They are easily spotted on the busy roads with their orange,white and brown livery. Two-way radio connects drivers with the Communications Centre in the City in case of breakdown or accident.Most of the buses are double-decker one-man operated,with a number of single deckers.There is an all-night service . Hyde Central and the newly opened Flowery Field are on two{local railway {lines}into Manchester. Trains leave Flowery Field every 30 minutes but on the Hyde Central line trains only run in the{rush hours;}both lines are closed on Sundays.All trains are multiple units,the first line is electrified and the second uses diesel units. A{ticket}to Manchester costs 74 pence single.
